page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: HOUSING IN STAUNTON ON WYE Most houses in Staunton are owner- occupied but there is some rented property and 14 council houses in the centre of the village. In Mansell Gamage and Byford many houses are owned by Garnons and occupied by estate workers or their widows while others have been recently sold off the estate. There has been little new building in Staunton over the last few years. Many of the houses are half timbered, 17th century or earlier. In Staunton are Orchard Cottage, a welsh long house, rare in this area andThe Ridge, the only thatched cottage. Many of the Garnons Estate houses are Victorian. Mansell Gamage church has been turned into an unusual dwelling by the owner, Nicholas Bulmer.
